verbs.description: resilver (third-person singular simple present resilvers, present participle resilvering, simple past and past participle resilvered)

examples: It often becomes necessary to resilver the small mirror used in a microscope, sextant, or other instrument of precision.

entries.meaning: (computing, transitive) To synchronize the mirror disk of the RAID array with the master disk.
examples: To get back to our RAID 0 +1 configuration, disk volume A will be “resilvered” up to disk B, which runs at the current point in time.
